author: BelgianBricker
title: Hit and miss
review:
For kids, this is a nice set: you get 2 vehicles, two nice minifigs, a bunch of useful accessories and even some structural/terrain build. There are no stickers, so you wont need to worry about them being place wrong or crocked. 
This set triggers children's imagination: I can see them fueling the car, doing maintenance on the spaceship, maybe having a race etc etc...

There are, on the other hand, also some negative things about this set: yet again, LEGO manages to use odd colors in visible places: the white tires on the buggy and the 2 white 1x4 plates on the spaceship really hurt my eyes! Why oh Why aren't they gray/grey like they should be? The build is sometimes also to oversimplified: especially the car. I mean, If you have no problem with 4yo building the maintenance cart, then why make the car so overly simple?

PROS:

-classic space vibe
-no stickers!!
-nice selection of useful pieces (of you are into space)
-Benny (you cant get enough Bennys)

CONS:

-build is too simplified, even for a 4yo
-printing on the pieces is slightly off (come on LEGO)
-strange color choices.

Is the set a must-have? In no way. Even not when you bought it because of the classic-space vibe (like I did). Get it at discount, or simply settle with Benny;s space squad.
